thread.title: Braves explore spring training move to St. Petersburg
thread.title_full: Braves explore spring training move to St. Petersburg | www.ajc.com

title: Braves explore spring training move to St. Petersburg
text:
A group led by the Atlanta Braves has proposed converting a 240-acre site - formerly a landfill - near St. Petersrbug, Fla., as a potential site for the team's spring training facility, a report in the Tampa Bay Times states .
The Braves have been considering options for a spring-training home for when their lease at Disney’s ESPN Wide World of Sports complex in Orlando expires in 2017 .
The new facility would include athletic fields, a hotel, office space and a sports medicine facility, according to the request for proposal submitted in August to Pinellas County.
The group — comprised of the real estate development firm Echelon; the Gary Sheffield Sports Foundation; and the Atlanta Braves — estimated the development would cost about $660 million.
The plans call for a 10,000-seat baseball stadium with berm seating for an additional 1,000 fans.
Braves president John Schuerholz writes in the 258-page proposal, the Tampa Bay Times reports, that construction could begin by next year with the facility set for completion by the 2018 season.
» Check back for updates to this story on myAJC.com
